Data: 6.50pm: Australia win the toss and bowl, Warner continues with his 100% record at the toss and exercises the option to chase again. Aaron Finch is fit to return at the top of the order, with Travis Head making way. England have made a couple of changes, with Morgan missing out: Vince is his replacement, while Liam Dawson brings another spin option, Mark Wood the man to make way.
Kane Richardson to Roy, 2 runs back of a length, Roy prods and gets a thick inside edge past his stumps for a couple to fine leg as they come haring back
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 wide short, 135kph and veering down the leg side
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run length, rising to hit the splice as Roy presses on to the front foot
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 run banged in short and Roy swivels on a pull to the man at deep square leg

Kane Richardson to Hales, 3 runs slightly wayward again, dragged down and there's room for Hales to swing his arms at his first ball and clock it through the covers, Warner giving chase to prevent four
Kane Richardson to Roy, no run dug in, 135kph and climbing through as Roy comes down and bails out of an attempted pull
Kane Richardson to Roy, 1 wide shortish, big swing and a miss from Roy - too close to the tramlines, though
Kane Richardson to Roy, FOUR runs back of a length, Roy latches on and cracks the ball through midwicket, beats the man on the ring and it races away for the first boundary of the day
Stanlake to Hales, no run length outside off, rising up as Hales stabs it towards point

Stanlake to Hales, OUT Hales smashes the ball into the air, it's high but overs Finch at mid-on... oh, taken at the second attempt on the run! Stanlake strikes second ball thanks to an excellent catch over his shoulder by Finch. Hales, playing his 50th T20I, fails in an attempt to assert himself early
Stanlake to Roy, 1 run length, 148kph outside off, dabbed to third man on the back foot
Stanlake to Malan, no run hits the pitch hard, Stanlake pushing the gun up to 148kph again, Malan tries to pull his first ball and splices short of midwicket
Stanlake to Malan, no run oof, that has ripped through, touching 150kph/93mph and decking away as Malan feels for it and is beaten
Stanlake to Malan, 1 wide banged in very short, all height and no trousers this time, not troubling the batsman
Stanlake to Malan, 1 run fired in full and Malan gets a chunk of bat in it, mid-on cuts it off as they scuttle through
Kane Richardson to Malan, 1 run short of a length and tucked off the hip for one

Kane Richardson to Roy, OUT slightly short, Roy hangs back and tries to guides to third man - but nicks it to the keeper instead! Richardson strikes now, bit of a freebie as Roy got a bit casual rather than going hard, scraped the toe of the bat through to Carey. England two down early
Kane Richardson to Vince, 1 run pitched up in the channel and Vince strokes one to the cover sweeper to get going
Kane Richardson to Malan, 1 run short ball, 133kph and swivel-jabbed for one through midwicket

Kane Richardson to Vince, FOUR runs short and wide and slashed between slip and gully for four! Saw a few of those during the Tests, but there's not so much protection here and Vince picks up a first boundary

Kane Richardson to Vince, FOUR runs and again, Carey only able to get fingertips on it! This was closer to him as he tried to cut, flew off the top edge but the keeper couldn't quite grab it despite an impressive dive. Slip had gone wider, too
Stanlake to Malan, no run short of a length, Malan goes to pull
Stanlake to Malan, 2 runs pitched up, 148kph and Malan pings it off his toes through midwicket for a couple
Stanlake to Malan, 1 run back of a length, worked off the hip
Stanlake to Vince, 1 run in the channel, 145kph and worked into the leg side as Vince moves across
Stanlake to Malan, FOUR runs short, 140kph and ramped over gully for four! Nicely played, using Stanlake's pace and it bounces to the rope

Stanlake to Malan, OUT tip and run, but there's a direct hit from mid-off! Malan is short! Brilliant work from Warner, collecting low down and releasing a right-arm rocket in one fluid movement - both feet in the air as he lets go - and Malan just keeps on running! He knew he was in trouble but it still required a lightning pick up and release to catch him short of his ground
Kane Richardson to Buttler, no run shortish and defended coming across
Kane Richardson to Buttler, no run ooh, beats the outside edge, 133kph and a bit of nibble as Buttler feels for it
Kane Richardson to Buttler, no run length, tapped downs square
Kane Richardson to Buttler, 1 run comes across and pats the ball down square, Vince is more assertive this time and calls them through, the underarm from point misses anyway
Kane Richardson to Vince, 1 run length around off and Vince taps another single into the off side
Stoinis to Vince, 1 run length ball, angling in and worked away off the hip
Stoinis to Buttler, no run short, 127kph and Buttler gets in a bit of a tangle trying to pull, loops off the toe but into the gap between mid-on and midwicket
Stoinis to Buttler, no run comes across and defends

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR runs dug in short, Buttler pulls and the ball flies off the top edge, but he gets it fine of deep backward square leg! Almost went all the way, in the end - bit streaky though
Stoinis to Buttler, no run pitched up and punched towards mid-on
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run fullish outside off and Buttler drills the ball to mid-off, this time Warner goes for the non-striker's end but Vince looked to be home safely
Tye to Buttler, 2 runs short ball, whipped off the hip and into a gap at deep square for a couple
Tye to Buttler, 1 run angled in on the stumps and worked away

Tye to Vince, no run panic at the disco... but Tye drops the ball trying to run out Buttler! Vince's pull picked out midwicket but Buttler had gone racing down,Finch's throw bounced up and Tye looked to have it in his hands but let go just as he was breaking the stumps. Would have been tight, Buttler maybe got his bat back
Tye to Vince, no run slower ball in the channel, swing and a miss
Tye to Vince, 1 run slashed wide of the keeper! Thick outside edge on the drive from Vince, single to third man
Tye to Buttler, 3 runs full on off, Buttler crunches a drive wide of mid-off for a few
Agar to Buttler, no run tossed up nicely on off and Buttler prods it away towards extra cover
Agar to Buttler, 1 run darted in much quicker and Buttler forces it away through cover point to bring up the England 50
Agar to Vince, no run fired quick, 100kph and leg side, hits the pads
Agar to Vince, no run tossed up and Vince mistimes a push back to the bowler
Agar to Vince, 1 run angled flat on the stumps, quick and straight again, Vince steps down and tickles one to midwicket
Agar to Buttler, 2 runs nicely placed by Buttler, working against minimal turn and he nudges square off his pads for a couple
Stoinis to Vince, 1 run length, 133kph outside off, dabbed down to third man
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run angled in with the arm and tucked into the leg side
Stoinis to Vince, no run taking the pace off, short and Vince cloths a pull towards midwicket, lands short but there's no time to steal a run
Stoinis to Vince, 1 run another cutter, 110kph and Vince waits on it, dabs square
Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR runs full on off, Buttler had dummied a shimmy to leg and instead just stays still and crunches a drive past extra cover for four
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run fired in full on the stumps and clipped through midwicket
Agar to Buttler, 1 run darted in on the pads and worked to short fine leg for a quick single
Agar to Vince, 1 run looped up and Vince comes down, whips a single through the leg side
Agar to Buttler, no run bit of flight, tossed up on off and tapped into the covers where Agar chases it down
Agar to Buttler, 1 run floated up on middle and leg, Buttler works it through mid-on for one more
Agar to Vince, 2 runs flat on leg stump, Vince clips it away square to the sweeper
Agar to Vince, 1 run fired into the pitch, short but skipping on as Buttler forces it away through midwicket, just a single again
Tye to Vince, no run legcutter outside off, bottom-edged into the leg side as Vince comes down
Tye to Vince, 1 run steered through cover point
Tye to Buttler, 1 wide banged in short and slightly leg side
Tye to Buttler, 1 run short, 125kph and Buttler jumps into a swivel-pull to deep square leg

Tye to Vince, OUT bowled 'im! Vince suckered by the slower ball! Loopy, seductive knuckleball from Tye but Vince never picked it, backing away to try and lash through cover, the ball dips to hit off and send him on his way
Tye to Billings, no run full speed, good length and punched square, terrific bit of fielding from Maxwell at point prevents one
Tye to Billings, no run fullish on off, comes down and again can't get the ball away
Stanlake to Buttler, no run length outside off and Buttler can't get it away
Stanlake to Buttler, no run full in the channel, driven past extra cover but Warner races from mid-off to intercept
Stanlake to Buttler, 1 run squeezes down on the ball and gets a single through backward point
Stanlake to Billings, no run length, 145kph/90mph and sizzling into the gloves as Billing dances down and fails to connect with a push drive
Stanlake to Billings, no run fired in straighter, 142kph and hitting the splice as Billings defends
Stanlake to Billings, 1 run touch full and leg side but Billings neat clip goes straight to deep midwicket for a single
Tye to Buttler, 1 run slower outside off and mistimed through point
Tye to Billings, 1 wide out the front of the hand but this swerves outside the tramlines

Tye to Billings, FOUR runs short and reverse-hoicked over gully, almost goes all the way! Coming forwards, ambitious shot, maybe expecting the slower ball but it flew off the top edge for a one-bounce four
Tye to Billings, 1 run comes forward and drills down the ground
Tye to Buttler, no run goes short and Buttler can't get it away, swatted down into the off side
Tye to Buttler, 2 runs back of a length and pulled, gets a couple towards deep backward square leg
Tye to Buttler, 1 wide another knuckleball goes wrong as Buttler charges out
Tye to Buttler, no run slower delivery, Buttler is sets for the reverse-pan handle over backward point... but completely fails to connect
Stanlake to Billings, FOUR runs length outside off, Billings makes room and rifles a drive past cover into the unguarded part of the ground
Stanlake to Billings, FOUR runs short and clubbed down the ground now, clears mid-on and it races away for four more

Stanlake to Billings, OUT gone - slugged into the air and Warner takes it at mid-off! Billings' brief flurry is dealt with, Stanlake is a hard man to hit down the ground often, this was just too quick and his cross-batted mow lobbed up off the top edge
Stanlake to Buttler, FOUR runs edged past the leaping Carey for four! Only his third boundary, gets a bit lucky but it flew beyond the fingertips
Stanlake to Buttler, 1 wide moves across looking for the ramp, fired leg side
Stanlake to Buttler, no run again Buttler is low and into position for the leg-side scoop, can't connect and I think it flicked the pad on the way through to Carey, so no wide this time
Stanlake to Buttler, 2 runs length, 142kph and heaved into the leg side, won't get to the rope and it lands safely between two boundary riders for a couple more
Tye to Willey, 1 run angled across and Willey dabs it behind point
Tye to Buttler, 1 run fires in the yorker, 137 kays on middle and leg, Buttler was standing on off stump and did well to dig it out down the ground for one
Tye to Willey, FOUR runs up periscope! Short and taking the pace off, loopy bumper on leg stump and Willey delicately taps it wide of Carey for four
Tye to Willey, no run full and straight and edged into the pads swinging hard to leg
Tye to Willey, 1 run floated up and flipped into the deep midwicket area for one
Tye to Buttler, 2 runs full outside off, 117kph as Buttler sweeps, down on one knee looking to manufacture something, gets a couple wide of fine leg
Kane Richardson to Willey, FOUR runs short, Willey swings hard, top-edges four over the keeper! Been England's most productive shot, that

Kane Richardson to Willey, OUT got him, top-edged into the covers! Richardson took the pace off and Willey's big heave only succeeds in giving him the heave ho... Warner again calmly underneath to complete the dismissal
Kane Richardson to Buttler, 2 runs short, Buttler hammers a pull towards deep midwicket, they come racing back and he dives to make sure of two
Kane Richardson to Buttler, 1 run Buttler backs off, Richardson spears the ball in full towards the blockhole, he can only dig out one down the ground
Kane Richardson to Jordan, 1 run full, slower at 117kph and Jordan can only whack one through cover

Kane Richardson to Buttler, OUT pitched up, slogged down the ground... and Agar snags it on the run! Another excellent catch, Australia have been good in the field again, Buttler falls from the last ball looking for a boundary to finish a luke-warm effort. Seemed like he might have got hold of it, a flat, straight hit but taken smartly racing across to his left

8.50pm Australia will certainly take that. England could never get going and, despite Jos Buttler being out there for more than 15 overs, they fall someway short of 150, which is roughly par for T20s at the MCG. A measure of how he had to play the anchor was that Buttler was the only batsman to score at less than a run a ball - only the second time he has been shackled like that in an innings of 20+ (coincidentally, the other was at the MCG,
David Willey with the first over...he has a slip in place
Willey to Warner, no run good start, short of a length outside off with a hint of swing and Warner is prodding away from his body without any footwork
Willey to Warner, 2 runs just over midwicket! Short of a length, a short-arm whip/pull, a shot that has caused him a few problems, and it narrowly evades the fielder
Willey to Warner, no run good length at off stump, defended
Willey to Lynn, no run almost through him like Hobart! Lynn staying on leg stump, there's some swing back on a good length, takes the back leg towards slip
Willey to Lynn, FOUR runs slashed away, full outside off, gives himself some room and carved over point
Tom Curran to Short, 1 run over the wicket, good length at off stump, pushed into the covers
Tom Curran to Lynn, FOUR runs too short, Lynn goes up and over the off side, well clear of the in field and carries a long way towards the rope
Tom Curran to Lynn, no run fuller, outside off, a big swing and a miss as he aims down the ground
Tom Curran to Lynn, FOUR runs and this time he hammers a slower ball square through the off side, just waited a fraction longer
Tom Curran to Lynn, SIX runs all the way, down the ground! Lynn doing what he talked about in that interview, plundering the ball straight down the ground. Full, in the slot, through the line
Tom Curran to Lynn, 1 run nearly picks out deep square leg! A big full toss, swung high into the leg side and Billings can't quite reach it
Willey to Lynn, 5 wide round the wicket, gets it wrong, speared full down the leg side, and also evades a diving Buttler
Willey to Lynn, 1 leg bye this is straighter, fired in at the pads, deflects to the off side
Willey to Short, no run back over the wicket to Short, full at the stumps, takes him on the back pad...perhaps inside edge, sliding down leg
Willey to Short, no run swings to the leg side against a length delivery and only finds fresh air, not far from being bowled
Willey to Short, no run nicely bowled, full outside off with some swing, beats Short as he drives away from his body
Willey to Short, no run beats him again, slightly shorter this time, late movement to take it past the outside edge
Willey to Short, no run back of a length at off stump, defended to point
Jordan to Lynn, 1 run full outside off, driven powerful into the covers, there's a hand on the ball to take the pace off it
Jordan to Short, 1 wide down the leg side, poor line
Jordan to Short, FOUR runs just a hint of width outside off and that's some power from Short, cracks it behind point with a thunderous square drive
Jordan to Short, 1 run fuller and straighter, at the stumps, tucked into midwicket...certainly no run rate pressure for Australia
Jordan to Lynn, no run a short ball, 141kph, Lynn goes for the pull and it scoots over the top edge
Jordan to Lynn, 1 run double-bluff, field set for the short ball and he pulls out a yorker, outside leg stump, than Lynn jabs out by his feet
Jordan to Short, FOUR runs he's timed that wonderfully, a full delivery outside off, gets a stride forward and places it between cover and mid-off
Willey to Lynn, no run round the wicket, a short delivery, Lynn is across the crease trying to pull through square leg but doesn't make contact
Willey to Lynn, no run full, outside leg stump, scoots between Lynn's legs to Buttler
Willey to Lynn, no run and now another short one, Lynn is well outside leg and attempted a leg-side heave without contact
Willey to Lynn, SIX runs low full toss at the pads, he stands still this time and effortlessly flicks this over fine leg for six. Great wrists
Willey to Lynn, 1 leg bye full at the pads, misses the pad as Lynn as a mighty swing and deflects to the off side
Willey to Short, no run full at off stump, dug out back to the bowler

Jordan to Lynn, FOUR runs pumped over the leg side! A crunched off the middle of the bat...poor delivery, a low full toss angled in at leg stump, Lynn's bat sweep is immense as he flicks it over mid-on
Jordan to Lynn, no run responds with the slower ball, Lynn is through his shot and gets an inside edge into his pads
Jordan to Short, no run a slower ball at the pads, brings an appeal lbw, surely pitched outside leg...they opt against the review
Jordan to Short, 1 run short of a length, tucked into the leg side
Jordan to Maxwell, no run back of a length at off stump, 139kph, defended to the covers
Rashid to Short, 1 run full outside off, driven to long-off
Rashid to Maxwell, no run full and straight, defended on the front foot
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run whipped from off stump through midwicket
Rashid to Short, 1 run short of a length outside off, Short works it behind square on the leg side
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run gives himself some room outside leg, drives into the covers without much timing
Rashid to Short, no run tries to work this with the spin but gets taken on the pads. Tidy start from Rashid
Dawson to Maxwell, 1 run round the wicket, touch short to start with, driven off the back foot to deep cover
Dawson to Short, 1 run over the wicket, again a little short, driven down to long-on
Dawson to Maxwell, no run well bowled, this is fuller and nearly does Maxwell for length as he plays back
Dawson to Maxwell, no run he's forward this time and pushes a length delivery to the leg side
Dawson to Maxwell, 1 run sweeps a good length delivery well in front of square
Dawson to Short, 1 run plays with the turn from outside off, through square leg, they look for a second, there's a fumble but in the end decide against it
Rashid to Short, no run short outside off, picks out cover
Rashid to Short, 1 run more air, fuller and straight, flicked to deep midwicket
Rashid to Maxwell, no run brings out the reverse sweep, the ball is outside off, picks out short third man
Rashid to Maxwell, 2 runs moves outside leg stump to open the off side, carves it through the covers but the sweeper can get across
Rashid to Maxwell, no run the googly, not sure he read that one, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
Rashid to Maxwell, 2 runs gets this reverse sweep away, over the men at backward point and short third man, but doesn't have the legs to reach the rope as deep point scurries around
Dawson to Short, FOUR runs throws his hands through a crunching drive down the ground, delivery was a touch wider outside off, sent it perfectly between long-on and long-off
Dawson to Short, SIX runs and this time he clears all the fielders...this is fuller, it's a skimming drive over long-on
Dawson to Short, 2 runs this time it's placed neatly through the covers off the back foot...very neat batting
Dawson to Short, 1 run worked into the leg side
Dawson to Maxwell, no run length outside off, cracked to cover
Dawson to Maxwell, SIX runs and now Maxwell finds the crowd...stand-and-deliver blow over long-on, stayed in his crease, that's a massive over
Rashid to Short, 1 run turned into the leg side
Rashid to Maxwell, FOUR runs another reverse, to a back-of-a-length ball, gets it find of short third man...placement perfect
Rashid to Maxwell, FOUR runs blasted down the ground, a fierce straight drive which splits the deep fielders. He's not hanging around
Rashid to Maxwell, SIX runs over long-on! This isn't going to last long...stays in his crease this time, it's a full delivery, times it over the fence
Rashid to Maxwell, FOUR runs a touch more of a heave about this one, gets it through midwicket but the placement is good again
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run held back a fraction outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
Tom Curran to Maxwell, 1 run a straight full toss is knocked through the leg side
Tom Curran to Short, 1 run back of a length at middle and leg, worked off his hip to long leg
Tom Curran to Maxwell, no run a short ball over off stump, Maxwell tries to ramp it over the keeper
Tom Curran to Maxwell, 1 wide a slower ball dragged down the leg side
Tom Curran to Maxwell, 2 runs takes a short-of-a-length ball into square leg and it's placed perfectly for the second
Tom Curran to Maxwell, 1 run big full toss, follows Maxwell, pushed to deep midwicket...just okay for height
Tom Curran to Short, 1 run poor ball, full outside leg, but only costs a single as it's clipped straight to long leg
Rashid to Short, 1 run square driven to deep point
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run full and straight, swung down to long-on
Rashid to Short, no run angled into backward point
Rashid to Short, no run appeal for a catch down the leg side and Buttler calls for the review...looks like it's clipped pad on the first replay. Hot Spot confirms that
Rashid to Short, 1 run worked off the stumps to deep square leg
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 wide pushed down the leg side, neat take but that's a wide
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run full toss, fired in quickly, says 118kph! Whipped to long-on
Jordan to Short, no run full outside leg stump, deflects off the pad to Buttler
Jordan to Short, 1 run a shorter delivery, 107kph, rolls his wrists and pulls to deep square leg
Jordan to Finch, no run short of a length, angled into the pads, goes for a pull but it takes the thigh pad
Jordan to Finch, FOUR runs short again, down the leg side, this time Finch catches it up with it and sends it very fine...actually glove rather than bat
Jordan to Finch, FOUR runs full outside off, heaved through the leg side wide of mid-on...nowhere nearly cleanly timed, but's a solid thick inside edge which runs away
Willey to Short, 1 run over the wicket, worked off the pads to short fine leg
Willey to Finch, SIX runs that's a monster down the ground...gets right underneath a full delivery and swings it into the first tier. That would do well on the golf course
Willey to Finch, SIX runs back to back sixes to win it! Width outside off, carved high over third man...Finch finishes it on his home ground

And that wraps things up for today. We'll be back when the series resumes in Wellington on Tuesday but for now you can head over and join the action from Johannesburg. For now, from Alan and Gnasher it's goodbye and see you next week.

Australia win by seven wickets and are in the tri-series final. That's a thrashing for England. So it's a race between them and New Zealand to join the Aussies at Eden Park. Australis superb from start to finish today, never let England get away in the field and closed out the chase in style. They put the pitch in perspective, not half as tricky as England made it look. There's some pondered for Eoin Morgan (injured today) and Trevor Bayliss
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 33 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Kane Richardson, AUS
